intro: Pseudoxandra bahiensis, commonly known as Brazilian rosewood, is a tropical tree native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic properties. The plant has elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement and bear small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds. Due to its high value for musical instrument making, it is also a species of concern for conservation.
